metadata.title: CVE-2022-4285 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low
metadata.description:
An illegal memory access flaw was found in the binutils package. Parsing anELF file containing corrupt symbol version information may result in adenial of service. This issue is the result of an incomplete fix forCVE-2020-16599.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4285` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gdb - 9.2-0ubuntu1~20.04.2
gdb-multiarch - 9.2-0ubuntu1~20.04.2
gdb-source - 9.2-0ubuntu1~20.04.2
gdbserver - 9.2-0ubuntu1~20.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: binutils-avr package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
gdb package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.2-0ubuntu1~20.04.2').
